title: Bug 49299 - Custom cookie name does not affect URL rewriting
description: In chapter 7.1.1 of the servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is stated that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will also be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session id is encoded in the URL (provided that URL rewriting has been enabled). However, the observed behavior is that the Reload link on the page still uses 'jsessionid' instead of the custom cookie name. An attachment named 'cookiename.war' is provided for reference.
OB:
When visiting the page, the following cookie is sent:
SetCookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnly
However, the Reload link on the page uses 'jsessionid'.

URL: http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;jsessionid=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F4
EB:
Expected behavior: If the phrase in 7.1.1 is to be followed, the Reload link should be:
http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F
